rules.title: White spaces
rules.abstract: In XML, the meaning of white spaces differs depending on their location. Spaces between block elements are for readability during authoring and are ignored during processing. Spaces in mixed content are significant. A correct and consistent use of white spaces leads to accurate processing and high-quality publications.

rule.rule-statement: In mixed content, include white spaces around inline elements, not inside them.

examplefig.desc: The white space is outside of the <uicontrol> element.
The white space is inside of the <uicontrol> element.
The white spaces are outside of the <xref> elements.
examplefig.codeblock: I love D2 and Google.

examplefig.desc: The white spaces are inside of the <sup> element.
The white spaces are inside of the <xref> elements.
examplefig.codeblock: I love D2 and Google.

rule.rule-statement: Do not insert white spaces at the beginning or at the end of blocks.

ul.li: Changes in white spaces will trigger a new translation of the block.
HTML ignores theses spaces, but some PDF and RTF rendering engines don't. We've seen publications where random paragraphs started with spaces.

rule.rule-statement: When spaces are required before or after punctuation marks, use the entity for non-breakable spaces ( ) instead of regular spaces.
rule.justification: Non-breakable spaces ensure that line breaks don't appear where they shouldn't.

examplefig.desc: As per best practices, this example uses the <q> element for quotes. When <q> is used, the transformation process is expected to handle quotation marks and the spaces immediately inside them, leaving one less thing to worry about for writers and translators.
examplefig.codeblock: Le professeur demanda : Quelle est la capitale de l'Australie ?

rule.rule-statement: Do not add any white spaces manually immediately inside quotation elements.

ul.li: The processing handles white spaces automatically for different media and languages.
It is common, in some media, to show long quotes as indented text. You can't assume quoted content will actually show up with quotation marks.

examplefig.codeblock: The term <q>accountability</q> is used because section 5.3.1.2 of the Business Process manual says <lq>The primary responsibility for reporting to management falls to the project lead who is accountable for the timetable and scope of each sprint.</lq>
examplefig.div: No spaces are added inside quote elements in EN or FR, but they are displayed correctly. Show display as blocks and text
